ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: It really depends on the class, but my class had a lot of well-established art majors and seniors, so it was amazing to see their specific styles and works!

I learned more about art than I ever have in this course. It's hard to articulate exactly what I learned with words, but you can see it in the difference between everyone's work at the beginning and end of the semester.

I was exposed to several different artists practices involving drawing. This fosters growth and exploration for personal work in relation to drawing. We were also provided information with proffesional art practices, and various skills that could be applied to our art making practices.
i learnt collage, how to use new materials, and how to critique other's work; we also worked on group projects which was super cool
Abstraction, different critique styles
Some techniques for drawing as well as helpful student and professor feedback

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Self directed for students who have already developed a personal artistic style.

If you're looking for a structured art class where the assignments are prompted by what materials to use, this might not be the best for you. For me, as someone who'd only worked with a narrow set of mediums, sometimes I would revert back to what I was comfortable using. This class doesn't teach you technical skills, but it's good for experimentation!
There was a great balance between lectures and critiques in this course. I wish we could have seen more of Rachelle's own work in class.

The class crit style was amazing, my favorite so far. Having it be different each time with different levels of engagement was very nice and productive. Group work sessions were certainly a highlight as well. Overall the structure of the class emphasized taking inspiration from our classmates whicch was infcredibly exciting for me. Personally I would've been interseted in what texts and readings would have been relevant to the class. Although adding readings would make the workload decentlly high, so an optional reading here or there would have been nice.

The biggest thing in the course was class size. There were almost 25 students in the class, and so critiques took up far too much time in the course and there wasn't enough in class workshops for there to be real help with the technical aspects. I think if the class was capped at 9 students or even split into two classes, everything would have functioned much better.
the class was amazing. I think it's strenghts were the group projects and the introdution to different mediums and new techniques.

Strength: generative for experimentation
Weakness: less structured feedback in critiques
Great projects. Maybe could use a little more strict time limits on crits

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would,  but only if they had the technical art skills beforehand!
Yes! Rachelles class is an excellent way to develop your practice and get great feedback while doing so.

I would recommend this to every art major at Yale. Rachelle is so devoted to her students and works with everyone individually to expand their practice. She knows how to make you a better artist by making you more you.
Yes without a doubt, both the material and proffesor are absolutely amazing, and I think it is a great oppurtunity to grow.
Yes, definatelly. You learn so much, it's so fun, and Rachelle is the best. She is always there to support you in any way and wants you to grow as an artist.
Yes, especially if you have an idea about where you want to take ur art practice
If they are passionate about drawing, yes
